Package poker

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    SimulatedPlayer
    Interface for a player, whether they hold a specific pocket hand or a range of pocket hands
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Card
    A class representing a card from a 52-card "French" deck
    Deck
    A class representing a "French" deck of cards, potentially with some of its 52 cards already dealt
    Hand
    Represents a five-card poker hand, with a value that allows it to be compared to other hands
    Heap<E>
    An instance is a min-heap or a max-heap of distinct values of type E
    with priorities of type double.
    HoleCards
    A representation of the two cards dealt preflop to a player
    Player
    A representation of a player, holding a given two cards
    Range
    A representation of a range, which is a set of possible pocket cards.
    RangePlayer
    A representation of an opposing player who possesses a given range instead of a specific hand Subclass of range due to ease
    SimulateVsHand
    An Monte Carlo simulation that calculates odds for a hand vs hand situation.
    SimulateVsRange
    Simulates the percent chance a player's hand wins against the range of hands another player can have.
    Tester  
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    HandType
    All the types of hands in poker.
    Rank
    Enumeration of all the card ranks.
    Suit
